Title: Knowledge management model for telemedicine
Source title: Proceedings of 2017 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2017
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Putri, N.K.S., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Hudiarto, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Argogalih, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: As a major issue not only in Indonesia, but also in the most countries around the world, healthcare has become the main topic of this paper. As a matter of fact, the use of information technology and information system for medical purpose is continuously growing. This phenomenon is widely known as telemedicine. Indonesia as the largest country in South East Asia has been facing healthcare as its key problem. The equal distribution of healthcare is difficult to achieve due to the geographical condition. Therefore, the need to implement knowledge management (KM) for telemedicine in Indonesia will help Indonesian society obtain medical knowledge simultaneously. The KM model for Telemedicine in Indonesia was derived from SECI model by Nonaka and Takeuchi. The conversion of 2(two) types of knowledge (tacit and explicit knowledge) were becoming the focus point. The research methodology used literature review and forum group discussion (FGD) with medical practitioners. Expectantly, most features created from this model, will become propose features for KM portal for telemedicine in Indonesia. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Knowledge Conversion; Knowledge Management; Knowledge Management Model; SECI Model; Spiral Model; Telemedicine
Index Keywords: Health care; Information use; Knowledge management; Telemedicine; Geographical conditions; Knowledge conversion; Knowledge management model; Medical practitioner; Research methodologies; SECI model; Spiral models; Tacit and explicit knowledge; Medical information systems

Title: Modeling Green balanced scorecard for private higher education institutions
Source title: Proceedings of 2016 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2016
Affiliations: School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Hudiarto, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Putri, N.K.S., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Argogalih, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this paper is to develop a balanced scorecard (BSC) for measuring green IT initiatives in the private higher education institution. The conception of the Green BSC was derived from Green IT Governance model for private higher education institution that already constructed from the prior research. The balanced score in the balanced scorecard provides a measurement for particular objectives set by the organization. However, in Green BSC, list of objectives were given to standardize the measurement for each private higher education institution. Institutions can calculate the balance score by themselves and implement the initiatives provide. Yet, further research may be applied to validate the propose model. © 2016 IEEE.
Author Keywords: BSC; Green Balanced Scorecard; Green BSC; Green IT; Higher Education
Index Keywords: Green computing; Information management; Records management; Balanced scorecards; Green BSC; Higher education; Higher education institutions; Education

Authors: Putri N.K.S., Hudiarto, Argogalih, Muljoredjo H.
Title: The use of green information technology governance model to determine capability maturity level in DKI Jakarta private higher education institutions
Source title: Journal of Theoretical and Applied Information Technology
Affiliations: School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Concentration Content Coordinator, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Computer Engineering Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Putri, N.K.S., School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Hudiarto, Concentration Content Coordinator, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Argogalih, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Muljoredjo, H., Computer Engineering Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Defined as the use of eco-friendly system and information technology, green Information Technology (IT) has been adopted in most world class universities worldwide. Meanwhile, DKI Jakarta as the capital city of Indonesia has a total of 325 private higher education institutions. Green IT term is quiet well known in these areas, although its implementation is still sporadic. However, information technology (IT) gives fully support toward the learning process at the campus area. As its project scope, this research was focused in DKI Jakarta, but it is applicable for others. Many research on green IT or green computing have been conducted, however none of them focusing on Private Higher Education Institutions in Indonesia. Based on the previous research done by various Private Higher Education Institutions,IBM and Green Computing Methodology by GTYS, the Green IT Governance Model for Private Higher Education Institutions in DKI Jakarta area was developed. However, further researches are expected in order to develop the best practice. Furthermore, energy saving, waste management systems and information technology will be controlled accordingly and the threat of toxins that can harm our health can be avoided. © 2005 - 2014 JATIT & LLS. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Green IT; Green IT model; Private higher education institution
